chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chenelle A Covington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation on Count 1

DNA surcharge waived by the court

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

defendant.name: Covington, Chenelle A
defendant.address: 515 W. Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
11:08 AM Defendant Chenelle A Covington in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Chenelle A Covington.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant was found guilty on 10/12/2022 on count #1 and count #2. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments and requests expunction. Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:

Count #1:
SENTENCE WITHHELD. 
20 days credit if any sentence imposed. 

Term of Probation: 12 months, TRANSFER TO MILWAUKEE ALLOWED

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Court orders the following:	
Count #2:
Fine:  $363.50
DNA Surcharge: WAIVED
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation on Count #1. 

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

10:02 AM Defendant Chenelle A Covington in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Chenelle A Covington. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 

State does not believe it has complied with victim rights on 22CF1526 as they were just notified yesterday and would like to attend the plea/sentencing hearing, and states that the victim on that case is still working to get a restitution figure. 

Defense states that the he just spoke with the victim, and provides information as to communication. 

Based upon victim non-notification, the Court will take a change of plea today only and set for a sentencing hearing for the State to provide victim notification. 

Defendant enters a guilty to count #1 and Count #2 of this case. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of count #1 and #2. Cases 22CF1259 and 22CF1503 are dismissed and read-in to this case. 

Sentencing hearing set.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
